title: Let's all just take a second to appreciate this long overdue Gragas fix

replies.body: http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/001/086/918/afb.gif
What is this gif from?
Pokemon X/Y
Weird... thought it was a Digimon or Ni No Kuni 2 gif or something, doesn't look like pokemon. (Note I haven't played X or Y)
The Pokémon is Flabebe's evolved form that no one cares about.
If its Fairy I care for it
Its not the evolved form. It's an alternate form.
Its because X/Y and ORAS are fully 3D not 2D pixel art.
Pokemon X I believe.
cant wait for the gragas 1 tricks in d1 to fall to plat now that their champ has counterplay in 1v1s
Uh what? While I would agree his hit box was BS, that is not where most of his 1v1 power came from.

> [{quoted}](name=TSM Piccaboo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WLuf6tUT,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-09-14T00:02:21.651+0000)

u never played against a d1 gragas 1 trick top then/

no counterplay to his entire combo if ur melee and trying to cs.

he e q aa for a free thunderlord
riven does exactly the same

Riven doesn't have long ranged harass, or a get out of jail free card if she's ganked with her mobility on cd. Riven doesn't scale into a pick making tank with good damage even if she just sits back and farms

While i agree on the harass, Riven never doesn't have mobility, as the only time she uses her E is to get out of a sticky situation or to close on you, and if shes closing, shes got her Q up to get back out if it turns out shes getting ganked. Plus the low CD on her w. barring that, she hits you with the knockup on her 3rd q, and then E's out because by that point, its off CD as well.
Except Gragas top's harass isn't meaningful because he maxes E in MOST match-ups.
At least riven is sitting here building damage gragas on the other hand can either go tank or ap when he chooses if hes fed woo hoo ap one shot time

But ad

Other wise she's riven and different and smexy
I like how this post is just talking about his body slam hitbox but you're talking about about his entire combo.

Now we need fix on other champions, Sion Q, Nautilus Q, Bard retarded Q, Shen E etc.

> [{quoted}](name=taleofsonata,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WLuf6tUT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-09-13T23:10:44.035+0000)
>
> Now we need fix on other champions, Sion Q, Nautilus Q, Bard retarded Q, Shen E etc.

Everything but {{champion:111}} Q is fine though. {{champion:14}}'s Q and {{champion:432}}'s Q are really predictable as long as you keep a distance from them. {{champion:98}}'s E is already as thin as it can possibly be.

> [{quoted}](name=inplane,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WLuf6tUT,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2017-09-14T00:53:33.909+0000)
>
> Everything but {{champion:111}} Q is fine though. {{champion:14}}'s Q and {{champion:432}}'s Q are really predictable as long as you keep a distance from them. {{champion:98}}'s E is already as thin as it can possibly be.

Sion's Q indicator is smaller than the spell's actual hitbox (when charged up)
which is interesting because it has this outline that is one of the most obvious indicators in LOL but the stun hits you even when you are clearly outside of the outline

It's not. There are a few factors that make it seem that way, most predominantly that most players are focused on where their champion's feet are relative to the Q indicator. Most champions have small/narrow feet, with wider torsos. A champion's hitbox attempts to include as much of the visual model as possible, and is a cylinder shape, so wider shoulders means a wider hitbox, even if the feet are tiny.

With Sion's Q, you have to be aware of your own champion's hitbox quirks.

> [{quoted}](name=Glory ln Death,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WLuf6tUT,comment-id=0000000200000001,timestamp=2017-09-14T17:02:10.059+0000)
>
> It's not. There are a few factors that make it seem that way, most predominantly that most players are focused on where their champion's feet are relative to the Q indicator. Most champions have small/narrow feet, with wider torsos. A champion's hitbox attempts to include as much of the visual model as possible, and is a cylinder shape, so wider shoulders means a wider hitbox, even if the feet are tiny.
> 
> With Sion's Q, you have to be aware of your own champion's hitbox quirks.

Hitbox's are circles, not cylinders.  League isn't 3D

If you use a naut Q on terrain you will find it is actually accurate to the portrayed hitbox when u hover the spell.
It's the hitboxes of other champions interacting with his Q that makes it bigger than it is.
Champion hitboxes are pretty funky. They don't usually match the visual model.

> [{quoted}](name=taleofsonata,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WLuf6tUT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-09-13T23:10:44.035+0000)

Shen's e hitbox is actually notoriously small as well.

Its a pleasant surprise that gameplay actually found something in the patch notes to like

Meanwhile, the AD version of Gragas just got buffed. 
{{champion:64}}
At least it wasn't a damage buff, and it's worse late. Not like Lee maxes W anyway, it probably wont do much
Morg bind next? That thing is way worse than even Thresh hook
It's the slowest moving projectile in the game, and Morgana does a telegraphed wind up beforehand...

No actually, unlike Thresh hook it _doesn't_ have a 'wind up time'. It does however move at the speed of an elderly paraplegic. However the projectiles speed is irrelevant if it hits you even when it visually didn't.
Most spells have one actually. Only they last around .75s or less which makes them tricky to notice.
Well yeah almost every spell has a delay but the ~0.1s delay on Morg Q doesn't make much difference.

She has a wind up most don't know about. She faces the exact direction the binding will go and does some motion with her hand. This is how you juke it because the actual q is hard to predict but her animation shows where it will go
